intro: Alloispermum michoacanum var. liebmannii, commonly known as the Michoacan mallow, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
